channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump returns to rally stage before friendly crowd in Arizona
item.description: The president-elect addressed a youth-focused conference of Turning Point USA, jumping from Cabinet picks to Elon Musk to Panama Canal fees.

item.title: It’s still the economy: What TV ads tell us about each campaign’s closing message
item.description: The final paid messages: Economy, culture wars and character.

item.title: Biden commutes most federal death sentences before Trump takes office
item.description: Prewident Joe Biden changed the sentences of 37 of the 40 inmates on death row to life without parole, saying he was convinced “that we must stop the ...

item.title: Harris is pounding Trump on fascism. Some Dems think that’s a mistake.
item.description: Harris has ratcheted up her warnings about the dangers of a second Trump term in recent weeks.

item.title: Just Exactly Whose Interest Is This Mayor Representing?

item.title: The Next Great Leap in AI Is Behind Schedule and Crazy Expensive
item.description: OpenAI has run into problem after problem on its new artificial-intelligence project, code-named Orion.

item.title: Biden: Trump’s tax and tariffs plans are a ‘major mistake’
item.description: Five weeks after the election, the president took his sharpest swing at Trump’s policy plans.

item.title: You’d be Wrong to Assume Sanctuary Cities Actually Want Any Help

item.title: Under Biden, a generational shift in U.S. views of Israel
item.description: Support for Israel was once widespread across the American political spectrum. Biden’s presidency has widened a deepening rift among Democrats.

item.title: Trump voters feel very differently about things now that he’s won, our new poll shows

item.title: If You're Checking That Bag, It Better Have an AirTag
item.description: Make sure the battery isn’t low and turn on Lost Mode—even if the luggage isn’t lost—for more frequent alerts.

item.title: Apple's App Store Puts Kids a Click Away From a Slew of Inappropriate Apps
item.description: An analysis recommends that Apple, an emerging target for digital-safety advocates, apply an independent review for software age ratings.

item.title: State Democratic parties use DNC chair race to pitch redistribution of power, money
item.description: State party leaders want to return to a more robust 50-state strategy with less centralized control by elected Washington leaders.

item.title: The Unlikely Ingredient That Could End U.S. Dependence on Chinese Batteries
item.description: Batteries that use sodium could allow the U.S. to create a completely new supply chain

item.title: How Scammers Are Using AI This Holiday Season to Steal Your Money
item.description: Fake licenses and passports are being generated to fraudulently verify identities—among other techniques.
